isis.stitle: SPICER 14 INCH (350 MM) SOLO CLUTCH - REMOVE

svcproc.title: TRANSMISSION
svcproc.para: Use a sling or transmission jack to support the transmission during removal. Never let the transmission hang unsupported in the splines of the driven disc. Following these precautions will prevent bending and distortion of the clutch driven disc.

step1.para: Disconnect the driveline from the transmission output yoke.

note.para: Before proceeding with transmission removal, if the clutch assembly is to be re-installed, depress the clutch pedal and slide the clutch wear indicating tab to the new position ( Figure 4). It may be necessary to lightly tap it, being careful not to break the tab. Release the clutch pedal.

step1.para: Disconnect the external clutch linkage from the transmission cross shaft lever.
Remove the transmission clutch housing to flywheel housing bolts.
Rotate the cross shaft lever to allow the release yoke fingers to clear the release bearing housing.
Carefully slide the transmission rearward and out.

caution.para: Support transmission weight during removal to prevent damage to the driven discs and release bearing.
